rev.comment: There have been numerous cases of necrophiles working in the [[funeral]] business, as it provides them with easy access to corpses.
rev.diff:
Line 1: Line 1: â
'''Necrophilia''' is a [[paraphilia]] characterized by a sexual attraction to [[corpse]]s. This has been a charactistic of several [[serial killer]]s, notably [[Ed Gein]], though it is very rare even in that context.
+
'''Necrophilia''' is a [[paraphilia]] characterized by a sexual attraction to [[corpse]]s. This has been a charactistic of several [[serial killer]]s, notably [[Ed Gein]], though it is very rare even in that context. There have been numerous cases of necrophiles working in the [[funeral]] business, as it provides them with easy access to corpses.
In [[California]], there were laws against mutilating a corpse or digging it out of a grave, but not against having sex with it. However, this changed on [[September 10]], [[2004]], when [[Governor of California|Govenor]] [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] signed a bill making necrophilic acts a felony punishable by up to eight years in prison. [http://www.sfexaminer.com/article/index.cfm/i/042204n_charges][http://www.reuters.com/newsArticle.jhtml?type=domesticNews&storyID=6208717]
In [[California]], there were laws against mutilating a corpse or digging it out of a grave, but not against having sex with it. However, this changed on [[September 10]], [[2004]], when [[Governor of California|Govenor]] [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] signed a bill making necrophilic acts a felony punishable by up to eight years in prison. [http://www.sfexaminer.com/article/index.cfm/i/042204n_charges][http://www.reuters.com/newsArticle.jhtml?type=domesticNews&storyID=6208717]
Line 7: Line 7:
Similarly in [[Alabama]], where it was considered that sexual acts with a body may constitute "abuse of a corpse", but not rape. [http://www.ca11.uscourts.gov/opinions/ops/19966752.OP.pdf]
Similarly in [[Alabama]], where it was considered that sexual acts with a body may constitute "abuse of a corpse", but not rape. [http://www.ca11.uscourts.gov/opinions/ops/19966752.OP.pdf]
â
In the [[United Kingdom]], [[penetration#Sexual penetration|sexual penetration]] of a corpse was banned with the new [[Sexual Offences Act 2003]].
+
In the [[United Kingdom]], [[penetration#Sexual penetration|sexual penetration]] of a corpse was banned with the new [[Sexual Offences Act 2003]], which makes it punishable by up to two years in prison.
